beartoss.description: Nobody explained to Milo that you better be nice when Santa Claus is watching.
beartoss.title: Beartoss

brushing.description: Santa brought Milo a mouthful of teeth. He got 3 new molars this week!
brushing.title: Brushing

habitot1.description: A rainy week with no preschool lasts a very long time. Among other pastimes, we visited Habitot's latest attraction: a space capsule. Felix is inside, wearing an astronaut jacket.
habitot1.title: Habitot 1

habitot2.description: Milo really likes Habitot's art studio. He gets to go there almost every week with Jorah and Lucy, his Thursday nanny.
habitot2.title: Habitot 2

kitty.description: Felix and Lucie enjoyed a rare treat this week: a whole day with no school, no work, no errands, and no Milo (he was with his nanny). Felix decided that what he really wanted to do was make a cat costume, so the morning was spent with the sewing machine (Lucie worked the needle, Felix the pedal). In the afternoon, Felix wore his costume to a "kid & mom" yoga class. The teacher was excellent, and even included several cat tail stretching exercices.
kitty.title: Kitty

nana1.description: Nana stayed for a few days, then hopped back in a plane on Christmas day to visit Granny in Natchez.
nana1.title: Nana 1

nana2.description: Nana's the Book Fairy.  There always seems to be new books floating around her.
nana2.title: Nana 2

snow1.description: Dean and Felix spent a day up at Tahoe.  It was Felix's first encounter with snow, and he absolutely loved it.
snow1.title: Snow 1

snow2.description: Pretending to be an Ewok in an igloo.
snow2.title: Snow 2

snow3.description: The Soda Springs ski area caters to kids.  On this gentle little slope, there's a conveyer belt that kids can stand on to get back to the top.
snow3.title: Snow 3

snow4.description: The coolest attraction was the inner tube sled run.   Your sled is hooked on a tow line that pulls you up the slope, so it's a fun ride both up and down.
snow4.title: Snow 4

xmas01.description: Forrest's parents, Moonbeam and Sunshine, organized a caroling party. We walked around their neighborhood singing Christmas songs in front of random houses.
xmas01.title: Xmas 1

xmas02.description:
Felix showed no fear in running up to Santa.
Santa: Tell me, little boy, what would YOU like for Christmas?
Felix: I want bad guys from Star Wars.
Santa: Bad guys? Like, Darth Vader?
Felix: Yes; and I want a land speeder, like the one they use in the desert.
Santa (a little uncertainly): In the desert? Okay, that sounds fun.
Felix: Oh, and my baby wants an airport.
Santa: And an airport for your baby. Alright, I got it.
xmas02.title: Xmas 2

xmas03.description: Baking Christmas cookies is a family affair.
xmas03.title: Xmas 3

xmas03b.description: On Christmas eve we discovered a neighborhood tradition. Many of the streets around us are lined with votive candles in paper bags. We vowed to decorate our block in the same manner next year.
xmas03b.title: Xmas03b

xmas04.description:
Felix bounced around like a neutron on Christmas eve.
Very sweetly, he put under the tree all the presents that he had made and wrapped himself (at school) for everyone.
xmas04.title: Xmas 4

xmas05.description: Last but not least before going to bed: leaving milk and cookies for Santa.  Note Baby Dog's stocking on the fireplace.
xmas05.title: Xmas 5

xmas06.description: ... and the next morning, amazing! The milk and cookies are gone, and the living room is overflowing with presents. With a lot of self restraint, Felix agrees to pause for a photo before diving in.
xmas06.title: Xmas 6

xmas07.description: Ready, set, go!  Open the presents!
xmas07.title: Xmas 7

xmas08.description: What could it be? What could it be? Yes! Storm troopers!
xmas08.title: Xmas 8

xmas09.description: Christmas morning with little kids is a lot of fun.
xmas09.title: Xmas 9

xmas10.description: This super cool astronaut helmet is from Papa John and Linda. Felix and Baby Dog immediately change into their space suits.
xmas10.title: Xmas 10

xmas12.description:
Darth Tater is a huge hit.
Felix (in his best Darth Vader voice): Luuuuke, I am your papa.
xmas12.title: Xmas 12

xmas13.description: Milo, caught in one his cute "ruff ruff ruff"'s. He is commenting on the collar that Santa gave Baby Dog for Christmas.
xmas13.title: Xmas 13

xmas14.description: Milo's favorite present by far is the music cube from Granny.
xmas14.title: Xmas 14

xmas15.description: Taking the brand new remote control truck for a spin.
xmas15.title: Xmas 15

xmas16.description: Dean makes a good control tower.
xmas16.title: Xmas 16

description:
Merry Christmas! Felix got into the spirit of the season big time. He made presents at school for everyone in the family, even Baby Dog. He left milk and cookies out for Santa, and was thrilled when they were gone in the morning.

Dean must have been pretty naughty this year, because Santa brought him a stomach virus that lasted Christmas Eve day through Boxing Day night (it's the reason this update is a little late). Still, we managed to have a good time.

Milo sings Mozart to himself! Okay, okay, just the opening melody of Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, but we are still impressed. He is also facinated with The Wheels on the Bus and other songs with gestures. Word of the week:
  • bagai: bad guy. Any of Felix's small robots or Star Wars figures. And it's almost always the ones that Felix considers bad, not good.
title: December 25
